description: Analog smoke/LPG/CO gas sensor module utilizing MQ-2 with protection and adjustable resistors. Detects LPG, i-butane, propane, methane, alcohol, hydrogen, and smoke with fast response and adjustable sensitivity.
application_examples: Gas leakage detection in home and industrial environments
Arduino-based smoke detection with buzzer and LED indicators

specifications.measuring_range: Detects LPG, i-butane, propane, methane, alcohol, hydrogen, smoke
specifications.response_time: Fast; warm‑up time ~20 seconds for stable output
specifications.interface: Analog output A0 (0.1–0.3 V), Digital TTL output D0 (0 V/5 V)

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to 5 V, GND to ground, A0 to an analog input pin, and D0 to a digital input pin on the microcontroller. Use a 4‑pin header with 2.54 mm pitch.

example_code.explaination: Reads the analog voltage from the MQ2 sensor. If the value exceeds a threshold, it activates a red LED, turns off the green LED, and sounds a buzzer. Otherwise, it activates the green LED, turns off the red LED, and stops the buzzer.

source_document: Handson Technology MQ2 Gas Sensor Module datasheet and application notes (provided text)
